definition: inferior (often in the combination 毫無遜色|毫无逊色, not in the least inferior)

sentences.english: The Southeast and the West fared worse.
sentences.chinese: 东南和西部地区进步要逊色一些。

sentences.english: Peony casts the other flowers into the shade.
"We felt hopeless in the first-half since we were unable to beat their excellent defence, "he said.
sentences.chinese: 上半场我们无法打破他们逊色的防守，我感到失望。

sentences.english: Western publishers have been no less enthused by China's continued rapid growth.
sentences.chinese: 西方出版商对中国快速经济增长的着迷毫不逊色。

sentences.english: the women no less than the men crowd round nudities.
sentences.chinese: 周围的女人们穿着上的裸露相比男人毫不逊色。

sentences.english: Penglai Pavilion should be, of course, no exception.
sentences.chinese: 当然了，这蓬莱阁也毫不逊色。

sentences.english: Hitchcock classical suspense novel ~ 74 as a story.
sentences.chinese: 希区柯克精典悬疑小说～74个逊色故事。

sentences.english: Language is concrete, no less so than speaking.
sentences.chinese: 语言这个对象在具体性上比之言语毫无逊色。

sentences.english: Other jade carvings pale beside this.
sentences.chinese: 其他玉雕跟这件相比大为逊色。

sentences.english: That scandal he was involved in before detracts from his glorious achievement.
sentences.chinese: 他以往卷入的那件丑闻已使他的光辉业绩大为逊色。

sentences.english: Often looking forward to your dream, I love no less.
sentences.chinese: 每每憧憬对你的梦想，我的爱毫无逊色。

sentences.english: Altair is not as bright as Vega and Deneb.
sentences.chinese: 牵牛星与织女和天津四相比，光亮度还是略为逊色。

sentences.english: Tony, compared with the first, is outshone but he is eager to marry me.
sentences.chinese: 托尼与之相比逊色多了，但迫不及待地要跟我结婚。

sentences.english: Sometimes, plan B is pretty good.
sentences.chinese: 有时，备选方案也毫不逊色。

definition: lit. to have no time for civilities (idiom)/fig. not to be outdone/not to yield to one's opponents
eager to excel/eager to get ahead in life/strong-minded
not to be inferior in any aspects (idiom)/to surpass/to outdo/(derog.) to be even worse
pinyin: you3 guo4 zhi1 er2 wu2 bu4 ji2

definition: to discuss two disparate things together (idiom); to mention on equal terms/to place on a par with/(often with negatives: impossible to mention X in the same breath as Y)
inferior/not up to par/to fall far short/to be mistaken
